function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments:
{"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Handling and manipulation of virus samples may lead to accidental exposure and transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of biophilic design, leading to a lack of nature-related features and patterns in the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient accessibility to nature-related features and spaces, limiting the potential health benefits of biophilic design.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to consider the impact of biophilic design on airborne disease transmission and contagion within the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to nature and natural elements in the built environment may lead to a lack of biophilic connections and reduced well-being.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for indoor air quality and ventilation may lead to the spread of airborne diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance of water features may lead to the proliferation of waterborne diseases and microbial contamination.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of greenery maintenance may lead to the accumulation of allergens, pests, and pathogens, contributing to health hazards.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of explicit design strategies and guidelines for translating biophilic design into architectural design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of validation for the effectiveness of biophilic design in buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of financial matters and building technology in biophilic architecture","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of 
’nature’ in architecture may not effectively mitigate contagious disease propagation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited quantitative studies in biophilic design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in quantifying environmental psychology factors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited evaluation criteria for non-physical architectural themes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of specific user groups in biophilic design may lead to inadequate health and well-being outcomes for certain individuals.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate quantification of exposure time to nature and contact frequency may result in suboptimal biophilic design outcomes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scientific substantiation and quantitative evaluation in biophilic architecture may lead to unverified design concepts and ineffective implementation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Structural problems and excessive humidity caused by plants in architecture","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insect troubles and odour issues caused by plants in architecture","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intensive energy use and maintenance required for highly artificial ’green’ designs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for air quality in biophilic design may lead to the spread of airborne diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting proper maintenance of plants in buildings can lead to the propagation of pests and disease-carrying insects.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration for the selection of indigenous plant species may disrupt the local ecosystem and increase the risk of invasive species and diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of 
’nature’ into buildings may create conditions for the propagation of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of diversity in biophilic design practices","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration of subfields in architectural research","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contested and ambiguous notion of 
’nature’ in biophilic design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misunderstanding of culture and context leading to inappropriate information or abuse","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"A sense of loss evoked when designs change negatively or are demolished","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex architectural shapes requiring higher budgets","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inevitable human error in mimicking nature may cause an unbalanced system","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disputes exist between unprocessed, crafted, and synthetic natural materials","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Biophilic design elements leading to excessive uncertainty and controversy","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlap and repetition of biophilic design elements","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient investigation of architectural design issues such as form, typology, scale, proportion, and technology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation and air quality control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to natural habitats for animals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Biophilic design could potentially contribute to the spread of contagious diseases through the creation of habitats for animals in urban areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of appropriate water management in biophilic design could lead to the proliferation of disease-carrying vectors such as mosquitoes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Biophilic design may not be effectively implemented in sustainable architecture","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disagreement on the interpretation of challenges in sustainable architecture","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variable contribution of architecture to different sustainable development goals sdgs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases spread in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlaps and repetitions in biophilic design elements may lead to confusion in interpretation and implementation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diverse nature attributes and their classification in architectural design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Divergent elements in nature-based architectural design theories","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological experience of nature in architectural design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ambiguous terminology around 
’experience of space and place’ and its relation to contact with nature","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlap and ambiguity in the categorization of nature-related elements in the frameworks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
